verses.verse: Yea <S%H2063><s%>, at this my heart <S%H3820><s%> trembleth <S%H2729><s%>, And is moved out <S%H5425><s%> of its place <S%H4725><s%>.
Hear <S%H8085><s%>, oh <S%H8085><s%>, hear the noise <S%H7267><s%> of his voice <S%H7267><s%>, And the sound <S%H6963><s%> that goeth out <S%H3318><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
He sendeth <S%H3474><s%> it <S%H8281><s%> forth under the whole heaven <S%H8064><s%>, And his lightning <S%H216><s%> unto the ends <S%H3671><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

After <S%H310><s%> it a voice <S%H6963><s%> roareth <S%H7580><s%>; He thundereth <S%H7481><s%> with the voice <S%H6963><s%> of his majesty <S%H1347><s%>; And he restraineth <S%H6117><s%> not the lightnings when his voice <S%H6963><s%> is heard <S%H8085><s%>.
God <S%H410><s%> thundereth <S%H7481><s%> marvellously <S%H6381><s%> with his voice <S%H6963><s%>; Great things <S%H1419><s%> doeth <S%H6213><s%> he <S%H3045><s%>, which we cannot comprehend.

For he saith <S%H559><s%> to the snow <S%H7950><s%>, Fall thou <S%H1933><s%> on the earth <S%H776><s%>; Likewise to the shower <S%H4306><s%> of rain <S%H1653><s%>, And to the showers <S%H4306><s%> of his mighty <S%H5797><s%> rain <S%H1653><s%>.
He sealeth up <S%H2856><s%> the hand <S%H3027><s%> of every man <S%H120><s%>, That all men <S%H582><s%> whom he hath made may know <S%H3045><s%> it <S%H4639><s%>.
Then the beasts <S%H2416><s%> go <S%H935><s%> into <S%H1119><s%> coverts <S%H4585><s%>, And remain <S%H7931><s%> in their dens <S%H695><s%>.
Out of the chamber of the south <S%H2315><s%> cometh <S%H935><s%> the storm <S%H5492><s%>, And cold <S%H7135><s%> out of the north <S%H4215><s%>.
By the breath <S%H5397><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> ice is given <S%H5414><s%>; And the breadth <S%H7341><s%> of the waters <S%H4325><s%> is straitened <S%H4164><s%>.
Yea <S%H2959><s%>, he ladeth the thick cloud <S%H5645><s%> with moisture <S%H7377><s%>; He spreadeth <S%H6327><s%> abroad the cloud <S%H6051><s%> of his lightning <S%H216><s%>:

And it is turned <S%H2015><s%> round about <S%H4524><s%> by his guidance <S%H8458><s%>, That they may do <S%H6467><s%> whatsoever he commandeth <S%H6680><s%> them Upon the face <S%H6440><s%> of the habitable <S%H776><s%> world <S%H8398><s%>,
Whether it be for correction <S%H7626><s%>, or for his land <S%H776><s%>, Or for lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>, that he cause it to come <S%H4672><s%>.
Hearken <S%H238><s%> unto this <S%H347><s%>, O Job: Stand still <S%H5975><s%>, and consider <S%H995><s%> the wondrous <S%H6381><s%> works of God <S%H410><s%>.
Dost thou know <S%H3045><s%> how God <S%H433><s%> layeth <S%H7760><s%> his charge upon them <S%H216><s%>, And causeth the lightning of his cloud <S%H6051><s%> to shine <S%H3313><s%>?
Dost thou know <S%H3045><s%> the balancings <S%H4657><s%> of the clouds <S%H5645><s%>, The wondrous works <S%H4652><s%> of him who is perfect <S%H8549><s%> in knowledge <S%H1843><s%>?
How thy garments <S%H899><s%> are warm <S%H2525><s%>, When the earth <S%H776><s%> is still <S%H8252><s%> by reason of the south wind <S%H1864><s%>?
Canst thou with him spread out <S%H7554><s%> the sky <S%H7834><s%>, Which is strong <S%H2389><s%> as a molten <S%H3332><s%> mirror <S%H7209><s%>?
Teach <S%H3045><s%> us what we shall say <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H6186><s%>; For we cannot set our speech in order by reason <S%H6440><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%>.
Shall it be told <S%H5608><s%> him that I would speak <S%H1696><s%>? Or should a man <S%H376><s%> wish <S%H559><s%> that he were swallowed up <S%H1104><s%>?
And now men see <S%H7200><s%> not the light <S%H216><s%> which is bright <S%H925><s%> in the skies <S%H7834><s%>; But the wind <S%H7307><s%> passeth <S%H5674><s%>, and cleareth them <S%H2891><s%>.
Out of the north <S%H6828><s%> cometh <S%H857><s%> golden splendor <S%H2091><s%>: God <S%H433><s%> hath upon him terrible <S%H3372><s%> majesty <S%H1935><s%>.

Touching the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>, we cannot find him out <S%H4672><s%>: He is excellent <S%H7689><s%> in power <S%H3581><s%>; And in justice <S%H4941><s%> and plenteous <S%H7230><s%> righteousness <S%H6666><s%> he will not afflict <S%H6031><s%>.
Men <S%H582><s%> do therefore fear <S%H3372><s%> him <S%H7200><s%>: He regardeth not any that are wise <S%H2450><s%> of heart <S%H3820><s%>.
